place.name: LLANLLYWEL
place.gazetteerText: LLANLLOWELL, a parish in Pontypool district, Monmouth; on the river Usk, 2 miles SSE of Usk r. station. Post town, Usk, under Newport, Monmouth. Acres, 796. Real property, £882. Pop., 87. Houses, 16. The property is much subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £130. Patron, the Rev. F. A. Williams. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
